snippet: Anas Haqqani, a son of the group’s founder, and Hafiz Rashid, a senior commander who coordinated suicide attacks, could become bargaining chips for the new Afghan government.
abstract: Afghan officials say two senior leaders of Haqqani Network are captured, in blow to component of Taliban; Anas Haqqani, son of the group’s founder, and Hafiz Rashid, senior commander who coordinated suicide attacks, could become bargaining chips for the new Afghan government.

byline.contributor: Matthew Rosenberg and Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Anas Haqqani, a son of the group’s founder, and Hafiz Rashid, a senior commander who coordinated suicide attacks, could become bargaining chips for the new Afghan government.

headline.main: 2 Haqqani Militant Leaders Are Captured, Afghan Officials Say
headline.print_headline: 2 Haqqani Militant Leaders Are Captured, Afghan Officials Say
